p: Okra, scientifically known as Abelmoschus esculentus, from the family Malvaceae is cultivated in subtropical as well as tropical and warm areas (Kumar et al., 2013). Okra seeds, pods, leaves, fruit, even bud, and stem can be used for therapeutic purposes (Yonas et al., 2014). Okra is abundant in functional components such as lipid, mineral, carbohydrate, dietary fiber, amino acid, and vitamin (folate, niacin, choline, A, K, E, β‐carotene).
